--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetails_group</a> - The name of the dimension group.
--   The only valid value is <tt>db.sql</tt>. Performance Insights searches
--   the specified group for the dimension group ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupIdentifier:GetDimensionKeyDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetails_groupIdentifier</a> - The ID of the
--   dimension group from which to retrieve dimension details. For
--   dimension group <tt>db.sql</tt>, the group ID is <tt>db.sql.id</tt>.
newGetDimensionKeyDetails :: ServiceType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetDimensionKeyDetails

-- | A list of dimensions to retrieve the detail data for within the given
--   dimension group. For the dimension group <tt>db.sql</tt>, specify
--   either the full dimension name <tt>db.sql.statement</tt> or the short
--   dimension name <tt>statement</tt>. If you don't specify this
--   parameter, Performance Insights returns all dimension data within the
--   specified dimension group.
getDimensionKeyDetails_requestedDimensions :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The AWS service for which Performance Insights returns data. The only
--   valid value is <tt>RDS</tt>.
getDimensionKeyDetails_serviceType :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails ServiceType

-- | The ID for a data source from which to gather dimension data. This ID
--   must be immutable and unique within an AWS Region. When a DB instance
--   is the data source, specify its <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For
--   example, specify <tt>db-ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTU1VW2X</tt>.
getDimensionKeyDetails_identifier :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails Text

-- | The name of the dimension group. The only valid value is
--   <tt>db.sql</tt>. Performance Insights searches the specified group for
--   the dimension group ID.
getDimensionKeyDetails_group :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails Text

-- | The ID of the dimension group from which to retrieve dimension
--   details. For dimension group <tt>db.sql</tt>, the group ID is
--   <tt>db.sql.id</tt>.
getDimensionKeyDetails_groupIdentifier :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse
GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse' :: Maybe [DimensionKeyDetail] -> Int -> GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse

-- | The details for the requested dimensions.
[$sel:dimensions:GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse'] :: GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse -> Maybe [DimensionKeyDetail]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse'] :: GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetailsResponse_dimensions</a> - The details for the
--   requested dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetailsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse :: Int -> GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse

-- | The details for the requested dimensions.
getDimensionKeyDetailsResponse_dimensions :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse (Maybe [DimensionKeyDetail])

-- | The response's http status code.
getDimensionKeyDetailsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Pi.GetDimensionKeyDetails.GetDimensionKeyDetails


-- | For a specific time period, retrieve the top <tt>N</tt> dimension keys
--   for a metric.
--   
--   Each response element returns a maximum of 500 bytes. For larger
--   elements, such as SQL statements, only the first 500 bytes are
--   returned.
module Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDimensionKeys</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDimensionKeys
DescribeDimensionKeys' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DimensionGroup -> ServiceType -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Text -> DimensionGroup -> DescribeDimensionKeys

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the data points returned from
--   Performance Insights. A period can be as short as one second, or as
--   long as one day (86400 seconds). Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> (one second)</li>
--   <li><tt>60</tt> (one minute)</li>
--   <li><tt>300</tt> (five minutes)</li>
--   <li><tt>3600</tt> (one hour)</li>
--   <li><tt>86400</tt> (twenty-four hours)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>, then Performance
--   Insights chooses a value for you, with a goal of returning roughly
--   100-200 data points in the response.
[$sel:periodInSeconds:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> Maybe Int

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   token, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> Maybe Text

-- | One or more filters to apply in the request. Restrictions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any number of filters by the same dimension, as specified in the
--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> or <tt>Partition</tt> parameters.</li>
--   <li>A single filter for any other dimension in this dimension
--   group.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:filter':DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The maximum number of items to return in the response. If more items
--   exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token
--   is included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
[$sel:maxResults:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> Maybe Natural

-- | For each dimension specified in <tt>GroupBy</tt>, specify a secondary
--   dimension to further subdivide the partition keys in the response.
[$sel:partitionBy:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> Maybe DimensionGroup

-- | The AWS service for which Performance Insights will return metrics.
--   The only valid value for <i>ServiceType</i> is <tt>RDS</tt>.
[$sel:serviceType:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> ServiceType

-- | An immutable, AWS Region-unique identifier for a data source.
--   Performance Insights gathers metrics from this data source.
--   
--   To use an Amazon RDS instance as a data source, you specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For example, specify
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>
[$sel:identifier:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> Text

-- | The date and time specifying the beginning of the requested time
--   series data. You must specify a <tt>StartTime</tt> within the past 7
--   days. The value specified is <i>inclusive</i>, which means that data
--   points equal to or greater than <tt>StartTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>StartTime</tt> must be earlier than the value for
--   <tt>EndTime</tt>.
[$sel:startTime:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> POSIX

-- | The date and time specifying the end of the requested time series
--   data. The value specified is <i>exclusive</i>, which means that data
--   points less than (but not equal to) <tt>EndTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>EndTime</tt> must be later than the value for
--   <tt>StartTime</tt>.
[$sel:endTime:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> POSIX

-- | The name of a Performance Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
[$sel:metric:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> Text

-- | A specification for how to aggregate the data points from a query
--   result. You must specify a valid dimension group. Performance Insights
--   returns all dimensions within this group, unless you provide the names
--   of specific dimensions within this group. You can also request that
--   Performance Insights return a limited number of values for a
--   dimension.
[$sel:groupBy:DescribeDimensionKeys'] :: DescribeDimensionKeys -> DimensionGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDimensionKeys</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:periodInSeconds:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_periodInSeconds</a> - The granularity, in
--   seconds, of the data points returned from Performance Insights. A
--   period can be as short as one second, or as long as one day (86400
--   seconds). Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> (one second)</li>
--   <li><tt>60</tt> (one minute)</li>
--   <li><tt>300</tt> (five minutes)</li>
--   <li><tt>3600</tt> (one hour)</li>
--   <li><tt>86400</tt> (twenty-four hours)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>, then Performance
--   Insights chooses a value for you, with a goal of returning roughly
--   100-200 data points in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_nextToken</a> - An optional pagination token
--   provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the
--   response includes only records beyond the token, up to the value
--   specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_filter</a> - One or more filters to apply in
--   the request. Restrictions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any number of filters by the same dimension, as specified in the
--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> or <tt>Partition</tt> parameters.</li>
--   <li>A single filter for any other dimension in this dimension
--   group.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of items
--   to return in the response. If more items exist than the specified
--   <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token is included in the
--   response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partitionBy:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_partitionBy</a> - For each dimension
--   specified in <tt>GroupBy</tt>, specify a secondary dimension to
--   further subdivide the partition keys in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceType:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_serviceType</a> - The AWS service for which
--   Performance Insights will return metrics. The only valid value for
--   <i>ServiceType</i> is <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifier:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_identifier</a> - An immutable, AWS
--   Region-unique identifier for a data source. Performance Insights
--   gathers metrics from this data source.
--   
--   To use an Amazon RDS instance as a data source, you specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For example, specify
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_startTime</a> - The date and time specifying
--   the beginning of the requested time series data. You must specify a
--   <tt>StartTime</tt> within the past 7 days. The value specified is
--   <i>inclusive</i>, which means that data points equal to or greater
--   than <tt>StartTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>StartTime</tt> must be earlier than the value for
--   <tt>EndTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_endTime</a> - The date and time specifying
--   the end of the requested time series data. The value specified is
--   <i>exclusive</i>, which means that data points less than (but not
--   equal to) <tt>EndTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>EndTime</tt> must be later than the value for
--   <tt>StartTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_metric</a> - The name of a Performance
--   Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupBy:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_groupBy</a> - A specification for how to
--   aggregate the data points from a query result. You must specify a
--   valid dimension group. Performance Insights returns all dimensions
--   within this group, unless you provide the names of specific dimensions
--   within this group. You can also request that Performance Insights
--   return a limited number of values for a dimension.
newDescribeDimensionKeys :: ServiceType -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Text -> DimensionGroup -> DescribeDimensionKeys

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the data points returned from
--   Performance Insights. A period can be as short as one second, or as
--   long as one day (86400 seconds). Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> (one second)</li>
--   <li><tt>60</tt> (one minute)</li>
--   <li><tt>300</tt> (five minutes)</li>
--   <li><tt>3600</tt> (one hour)</li>
--   <li><tt>86400</tt> (twenty-four hours)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>, then Performance
--   Insights chooses a value for you, with a goal of returning roughly
--   100-200 data points in the response.
describeDimensionKeys_periodInSeconds :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe Int)

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   token, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
describeDimensionKeys_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more filters to apply in the request. Restrictions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any number of filters by the same dimension, as specified in the
--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> or <tt>Partition</tt> parameters.</li>
--   <li>A single filter for any other dimension in this dimension
--   group.</li>
--   </ul>
describeDimensionKeys_filter :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The maximum number of items to return in the response. If more items
--   exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token
--   is included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
describeDimensionKeys_maxResults :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe Natural)

-- | For each dimension specified in <tt>GroupBy</tt>, specify a secondary
--   dimension to further subdivide the partition keys in the response.
describeDimensionKeys_partitionBy :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe DimensionGroup)

-- | The AWS service for which Performance Insights will return metrics.
--   The only valid value for <i>ServiceType</i> is <tt>RDS</tt>.
describeDimensionKeys_serviceType :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys ServiceType

-- | An immutable, AWS Region-unique identifier for a data source.
--   Performance Insights gathers metrics from this data source.
--   
--   To use an Amazon RDS instance as a data source, you specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For example, specify
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>
describeDimensionKeys_identifier :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys Text

-- | The date and time specifying the beginning of the requested time
--   series data. You must specify a <tt>StartTime</tt> within the past 7
--   days. The value specified is <i>inclusive</i>, which means that data
--   points equal to or greater than <tt>StartTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>StartTime</tt> must be earlier than the value for
--   <tt>EndTime</tt>.
describeDimensionKeys_startTime :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys UTCTime

-- | The date and time specifying the end of the requested time series
--   data. The value specified is <i>exclusive</i>, which means that data
--   points less than (but not equal to) <tt>EndTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>EndTime</tt> must be later than the value for
--   <tt>StartTime</tt>.
describeDimensionKeys_endTime :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys UTCTime

-- | The name of a Performance Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
describeDimensionKeys_metric :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys Text

-- | A specification for how to aggregate the data points from a query
--   result. You must specify a valid dimension group. Performance Insights
--   returns all dimensions within this group, unless you provide the names
--   of specific dimensions within this group. You can also request that
--   Performance Insights return a limited number of values for a
--   dimension.
describeDimensionKeys_groupBy :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys DimensionGroup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDimensionKeysResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDimensionKeysResponse
DescribeDimensionKeysResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [DimensionKeyDescription] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ResponsePartitionKey] -> Int -> DescribeDimensionKeysResponse

-- | The end time for the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a
--   granular boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedEndTime</tt> will be greater than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>Endtime</tt>.
[$sel:alignedEndTime:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'] :: DescribeDimensionKeysResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The start time for the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a
--   granular boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedStartTime</tt> will be less than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>StartTime</tt>.
[$sel:alignedStartTime:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'] :: DescribeDimensionKeysResponse -> Maybe POSIX

-- | The dimension keys that were requested.
[$sel:keys:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'] :: DescribeDimensionKeysResponse -> Maybe [DimensionKeyDescription]

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   token, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
[$sel:nextToken:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'] :: DescribeDimensionKeysResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | If <tt>PartitionBy</tt> was present in the request,
--   <tt>PartitionKeys</tt> contains the breakdown of dimension keys by the
--   specified partitions.
[$sel:partitionKeys:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'] :: DescribeDimensionKeysResponse -> Maybe [ResponsePartitionKey]

-- | The response's http status code.
[$sel:httpStatus:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'] :: DescribeDimensionKeysResponse -> Int

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDimensionKeysResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignedEndTime:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_alignedEndTime</a> - The end time for
--   the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a granular boundary
--   (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>). <tt>AlignedEndTime</tt>
--   will be greater than or equal to the value of the user-specified
--   <tt>Endtime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignedStartTime:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_alignedStartTime</a> - The start time
--   for the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a granular
--   boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedStartTime</tt> will be less than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>StartTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keys:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_keys</a> - The dimension keys that
--   were requested.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_nextToken</a> - An optional
--   pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response includes only records beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partitionKeys:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_partitionKeys</a> - If
--   <tt>PartitionBy</tt> was present in the request,
--   <tt>PartitionKeys</tt> contains the breakdown of dimension keys by the
--   specified partitions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeDimensionKeysResponse :: Int -> DescribeDimensionKeysResponse

-- | The end time for the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a
--   granular boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedEndTime</tt> will be greater than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>Endtime</tt>.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_alignedEndTime :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The start time for the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a
--   granular boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedStartTime</tt> will be less than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>StartTime</tt>.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_alignedStartTime :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The dimension keys that were requested.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_keys :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe [DimensionKeyDescription])

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   token, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>PartitionBy</tt> was present in the request,
--   <tt>PartitionKeys</tt> contains the breakdown of dimension keys by the
--   specified partitions.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_partitionKeys :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe [ResponsePartitionKey])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse Int
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeysResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeysResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeysResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeysResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeysResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.Pi.DescribeDimensionKeys.DescribeDimensionKeys


module Network.AWS.Pi.Lens

-- | A list of dimensions to retrieve the detail data for within the given
--   dimension group. For the dimension group <tt>db.sql</tt>, specify
--   either the full dimension name <tt>db.sql.statement</tt> or the short
--   dimension name <tt>statement</tt>. If you don't specify this
--   parameter, Performance Insights returns all dimension data within the
--   specified dimension group.
getDimensionKeyDetails_requestedDimensions :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The AWS service for which Performance Insights returns data. The only
--   valid value is <tt>RDS</tt>.
getDimensionKeyDetails_serviceType :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails ServiceType

-- | The ID for a data source from which to gather dimension data. This ID
--   must be immutable and unique within an AWS Region. When a DB instance
--   is the data source, specify its <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For
--   example, specify <tt>db-ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTU1VW2X</tt>.
getDimensionKeyDetails_identifier :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails Text

-- | The name of the dimension group. The only valid value is
--   <tt>db.sql</tt>. Performance Insights searches the specified group for
--   the dimension group ID.
getDimensionKeyDetails_group :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails Text

-- | The ID of the dimension group from which to retrieve dimension
--   details. For dimension group <tt>db.sql</tt>, the group ID is
--   <tt>db.sql.id</tt>.
getDimensionKeyDetails_groupIdentifier :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetails Text

-- | The details for the requested dimensions.
getDimensionKeyDetailsResponse_dimensions :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse (Maybe [DimensionKeyDetail])

-- | The response's http status code.
getDimensionKeyDetailsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse Int

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the data points returned from
--   Performance Insights. A period can be as short as one second, or as
--   long as one day (86400 seconds). Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> (one second)</li>
--   <li><tt>60</tt> (one minute)</li>
--   <li><tt>300</tt> (five minutes)</li>
--   <li><tt>3600</tt> (one hour)</li>
--   <li><tt>86400</tt> (twenty-four hours)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>, then Performance
--   Insights will choose a value for you, with a goal of returning roughly
--   100-200 data points in the response.
getResourceMetrics_periodInSeconds :: Lens' GetResourceMetrics (Maybe Int)

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   token, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
getResourceMetrics_nextToken :: Lens' GetResourceMetrics (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum number of items to return in the response. If more items
--   exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token
--   is included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
getResourceMetrics_maxResults :: Lens' GetResourceMetrics (Maybe Natural)

-- | The AWS service for which Performance Insights returns metrics. The
--   only valid value for <i>ServiceType</i> is <tt>RDS</tt>.
getResourceMetrics_serviceType :: Lens' GetResourceMetrics ServiceType

-- | An immutable, AWS Region-unique identifier for a data source.
--   Performance Insights gathers metrics from this data source.
--   
--   To use a DB instance as a data source, specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For example, specify
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>.
getResourceMetrics_identifier :: Lens' GetResourceMetrics Text

-- | An array of one or more queries to perform. Each query must specify a
--   Performance Insights metric, and can optionally specify aggregation
--   and filtering criteria.
getResourceMetrics_metricQueries :: Lens' GetResourceMetrics (NonEmpty MetricQuery)

-- | The date and time specifying the beginning of the requested time
--   series data. You can't specify a <tt>StartTime</tt> that's earlier
--   than 7 days ago. The value specified is <i>inclusive</i> - data points
--   equal to or greater than <tt>StartTime</tt> will be returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>StartTime</tt> must be earlier than the value for
--   <tt>EndTime</tt>.
getResourceMetrics_startTime :: Lens' GetResourceMetrics UTCTime

-- | The date and time specifying the end of the requested time series
--   data. The value specified is <i>exclusive</i> - data points less than
--   (but not equal to) <tt>EndTime</tt> will be returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>EndTime</tt> must be later than the value for
--   <tt>StartTime</tt>.
getResourceMetrics_endTime :: Lens' GetResourceMetrics UTCTime

-- | An immutable, AWS Region-unique identifier for a data source.
--   Performance Insights gathers metrics from this data source.
--   
--   To use a DB instance as a data source, you specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value - for example:
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>
getResourceMetricsResponse_identifier :: Lens' GetResourceMetricsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of metric results,, where each array element contains all of
--   the data points for a particular dimension.
getResourceMetricsResponse_metricList :: Lens' GetResourceMetricsResponse (Maybe [MetricKeyDataPoints])

-- | The end time for the returned metrics, after alignment to a granular
--   boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedEndTime</tt> will be greater than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>Endtime</tt>.
getResourceMetricsResponse_alignedEndTime :: Lens' GetResourceMetricsResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The start time for the returned metrics, after alignment to a granular
--   boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedStartTime</tt> will be less than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>StartTime</tt>.
getResourceMetricsResponse_alignedStartTime :: Lens' GetResourceMetricsResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   token, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
getResourceMetricsResponse_nextToken :: Lens' GetResourceMetricsResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | The response's http status code.
getResourceMetricsResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' GetResourceMetricsResponse Int

-- | The granularity, in seconds, of the data points returned from
--   Performance Insights. A period can be as short as one second, or as
--   long as one day (86400 seconds). Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> (one second)</li>
--   <li><tt>60</tt> (one minute)</li>
--   <li><tt>300</tt> (five minutes)</li>
--   <li><tt>3600</tt> (one hour)</li>
--   <li><tt>86400</tt> (twenty-four hours)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>, then Performance
--   Insights chooses a value for you, with a goal of returning roughly
--   100-200 data points in the response.
describeDimensionKeys_periodInSeconds :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe Int)

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   token, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
describeDimensionKeys_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe Text)

-- | One or more filters to apply in the request. Restrictions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any number of filters by the same dimension, as specified in the
--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> or <tt>Partition</tt> parameters.</li>
--   <li>A single filter for any other dimension in this dimension
--   group.</li>
--   </ul>
describeDimensionKeys_filter :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The maximum number of items to return in the response. If more items
--   exist than the specified <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token
--   is included in the response so that the remaining results can be
--   retrieved.
describeDimensionKeys_maxResults :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe Natural)

-- | For each dimension specified in <tt>GroupBy</tt>, specify a secondary
--   dimension to further subdivide the partition keys in the response.
describeDimensionKeys_partitionBy :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys (Maybe DimensionGroup)

-- | The AWS service for which Performance Insights will return metrics.
--   The only valid value for <i>ServiceType</i> is <tt>RDS</tt>.
describeDimensionKeys_serviceType :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys ServiceType

-- | An immutable, AWS Region-unique identifier for a data source.
--   Performance Insights gathers metrics from this data source.
--   
--   To use an Amazon RDS instance as a data source, you specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For example, specify
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>
describeDimensionKeys_identifier :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys Text

-- | The date and time specifying the beginning of the requested time
--   series data. You must specify a <tt>StartTime</tt> within the past 7
--   days. The value specified is <i>inclusive</i>, which means that data
--   points equal to or greater than <tt>StartTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>StartTime</tt> must be earlier than the value for
--   <tt>EndTime</tt>.
describeDimensionKeys_startTime :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys UTCTime

-- | The date and time specifying the end of the requested time series
--   data. The value specified is <i>exclusive</i>, which means that data
--   points less than (but not equal to) <tt>EndTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>EndTime</tt> must be later than the value for
--   <tt>StartTime</tt>.
describeDimensionKeys_endTime :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys UTCTime

-- | The name of a Performance Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
describeDimensionKeys_metric :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys Text

-- | A specification for how to aggregate the data points from a query
--   result. You must specify a valid dimension group. Performance Insights
--   returns all dimensions within this group, unless you provide the names
--   of specific dimensions within this group. You can also request that
--   Performance Insights return a limited number of values for a
--   dimension.
describeDimensionKeys_groupBy :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeys DimensionGroup

-- | The end time for the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a
--   granular boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedEndTime</tt> will be greater than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>Endtime</tt>.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_alignedEndTime :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The start time for the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a
--   granular boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedStartTime</tt> will be less than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>StartTime</tt>.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_alignedStartTime :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The dimension keys that were requested.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_keys :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe [DimensionKeyDescription])

-- | An optional pagination token provided by a previous request. If this
--   parameter is specified, the response includes only records beyond the
--   token, up to the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_nextToken :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe Text)

-- | If <tt>PartitionBy</tt> was present in the request,
--   <tt>PartitionKeys</tt> contains the breakdown of dimension keys by the
--   specified partitions.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_partitionKeys :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse (Maybe [ResponsePartitionKey])

-- | The response's http status code.
describeDimensionKeysResponse_httpStatus :: Lens' DescribeDimensionKeysResponse Int

-- | The time, in epoch format, associated with a particular
--   <tt>Value</tt>.
dataPoint_timestamp :: Lens' DataPoint UTCTime

-- | The actual value associated with a particular <tt>Timestamp</tt>.
dataPoint_value :: Lens' DataPoint Double

-- | The maximum number of items to fetch for this dimension group.
dimensionGroup_limit :: Lens' DimensionGroup (Maybe Natural)

-- | A list of specific dimensions from a dimension group. If this
--   parameter is not present, then it signifies that all of the dimensions
--   in the group were requested, or are present in the response.
--   
--   Valid values for elements in the <tt>Dimensions</tt> array are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.application.name</tt> - The name of the application that is
--   connected to the database (only Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS
--   PostgreSQL)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.host.id</tt> - The host ID of the connected client (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.host.name</tt> - The host name of the connected client (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.name</tt> - The name of the database to which the client is
--   connected (only Aurora PostgreSQL, RDS PostgreSQL, Aurora MySQL, RDS
--   MySQL, and MariaDB)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.session_type.name</tt> - The type of the current session
--   (only Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS PostgreSQL)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql.id</tt> - The SQL ID generated by Performance Insights
--   (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql.db_id</tt> - The SQL ID generated by the database (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql.statement</tt> - The SQL text that is being executed
--   (all engines)</li>
--   <li><pre>db.sql.tokenized_id</pre></li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql_tokenized.id</tt> - The SQL digest ID generated by
--   Performance Insights (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql_tokenized.db_id</tt> - SQL digest ID generated by the
--   database (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql_tokenized.statement</tt> - The SQL digest text (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.user.id</tt> - The ID of the user logged in to the database
--   (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.user.name</tt> - The name of the user logged in to the
--   database (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event.name</tt> - The event for which the backend is
--   waiting (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event.type</tt> - The type of event for which the
--   backend is waiting (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event_type.name</tt> - The name of the event type for
--   which the backend is waiting (all engines)</li>
--   </ul>
dimensionGroup_dimensions :: Lens' DimensionGroup (Maybe (NonEmpty Text))

-- | The name of the dimension group. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db</tt> - The name of the database to which the client is
--   connected (only Aurora PostgreSQL, RDS PostgreSQL, Aurora MySQL, RDS
--   MySQL, and MariaDB)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.application</tt> - The name of the application that is
--   connected to the database (only Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS
--   PostgreSQL)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.host</tt> - The host name of the connected client (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.session_type</tt> - The type of the current session (only
--   Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS PostgreSQL)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql</tt> - The SQL that is currently executing (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql_tokenized</tt> - The SQL digest (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event</tt> - The event for which the database backend
--   is waiting (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event_type</tt> - The type of event for which the
--   database backend is waiting (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.user</tt> - The user logged in to the database (all
--   engines)</li>
--   </ul>
dimensionGroup_group :: Lens' DimensionGroup Text

-- | If <tt>PartitionBy</tt> was specified, <tt>PartitionKeys</tt> contains
--   the dimensions that were.
dimensionKeyDescription_partitions :: Lens' DimensionKeyDescription (Maybe [Double])

-- | The aggregated metric value for the dimension(s), over the requested
--   time range.
dimensionKeyDescription_total :: Lens' DimensionKeyDescription (Maybe Double)

-- | A map of name-value pairs for the dimensions in the group.
dimensionKeyDescription_dimensions :: Lens' DimensionKeyDescription (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The status of the dimension detail data. Possible values include the
--   following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The dimension detail data is ready to be
--   retrieved.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROCESSING</tt> - The dimension detail data isn't ready to be
--   retrieved because more processing time is required. If the requested
--   detail data for <tt>db.sql.statement</tt> has the status
--   <tt>PROCESSING</tt>, Performance Insights returns the truncated
--   query.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> - The dimension detail data could not be
--   collected successfully.</li>
--   </ul>
dimensionKeyDetail_status :: Lens' DimensionKeyDetail (Maybe DetailStatus)

-- | The full name of the dimension. The full name includes the group name
--   and key name. The only valid value is <tt>db.sql.statement</tt>.
dimensionKeyDetail_dimension :: Lens' DimensionKeyDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The value of the dimension detail data. For the
--   <tt>db.sql.statement</tt> dimension, this value is either the full or
--   truncated SQL query, depending on the return status.
dimensionKeyDetail_value :: Lens' DimensionKeyDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | An array of timestamp-value pairs, representing measurements over a
--   period of time.
metricKeyDataPoints_dataPoints :: Lens' MetricKeyDataPoints (Maybe [DataPoint])

-- | The dimension(s) to which the data points apply.
metricKeyDataPoints_key :: Lens' MetricKeyDataPoints (Maybe ResponseResourceMetricKey)

-- | A specification for how to aggregate the data points from a query
--   result. You must specify a valid dimension group. Performance Insights
--   will return all of the dimensions within that group, unless you
--   provide the names of specific dimensions within that group. You can
--   also request that Performance Insights return a limited number of
--   values for a dimension.
metricQuery_groupBy :: Lens' MetricQuery (Maybe DimensionGroup)

-- | One or more filters to apply in the request. Restrictions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any number of filters by the same dimension, as specified in the
--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> parameter.</li>
--   <li>A single filter for any other dimension in this dimension
--   group.</li>
--   </ul>
metricQuery_filter :: Lens' MetricQuery (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of a Performance Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
metricQuery_metric :: Lens' MetricQuery Text

-- | A dimension map that contains the dimension(s) for this partition.
responsePartitionKey_dimensions :: Lens' ResponsePartitionKey (HashMap Text Text)

-- | The valid dimensions for the metric.
responseResourceMetricKey_dimensions :: Lens' ResponseResourceMetricKey (Maybe (HashMap Text Text))

-- | The name of a Performance Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
responseResourceMetricKey_metric :: Lens' ResponseResourceMetricKey Text


module Network.AWS.Pi.Waiters


-- | Derived from API version <tt>2018-02-27</tt> of the AWS service
--   descriptions, licensed under Apache 2.0.
--   
--   Amazon RDS Performance Insights
--   
--   Amazon RDS Performance Insights enables you to monitor and explore
--   different dimensions of database load based on data captured from a
--   running DB instance. The guide provides detailed information about
--   Performance Insights data types, parameters and errors.
--   
--   When Performance Insights is enabled, the Amazon RDS Performance
--   Insights API provides visibility into the performance of your DB
--   instance. Amazon CloudWatch provides the authoritative source for AWS
--   service-vended monitoring metrics. Performance Insights offers a
--   domain-specific view of DB load.
--   
--   DB load is measured as Average Active Sessions. Performance Insights
--   provides the data to API consumers as a two-dimensional time-series
--   dataset. The time dimension provides DB load data for each time point
--   in the queried time range. Each time point decomposes overall load in
--   relation to the requested dimensions, measured at that time point.
--   Examples include SQL, Wait event, User, and Host.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>To learn more about Performance Insights and Amazon Aurora DB
--   instances, go to the <a>Amazon Aurora User Guide</a>.</li>
--   <li>To learn more about Performance Insights and Amazon RDS DB
--   instances, go to the <a>Amazon RDS User Guide</a>.</li>
--   </ul>
module Network.AWS.Pi

-- | API version <tt>2018-02-27</tt> of the Amazon Performance Insights SDK
--   configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | One of the arguments provided is invalid for this request.
_InvalidArgumentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The user is not authorized to perform this request.
_NotAuthorizedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request failed due to an unknown error.
_InternalServiceError :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDimensionKeyDetails</a> smart constructor.
data GetDimensionKeyDetails
GetDimensionKeyDetails' :: Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> ServiceType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetDimensionKeyDetails

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDimensionKeyDetails</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requestedDimensions:GetDimensionKeyDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetails_requestedDimensions</a> - A list of
--   dimensions to retrieve the detail data for within the given dimension
--   group. For the dimension group <tt>db.sql</tt>, specify either the
--   full dimension name <tt>db.sql.statement</tt> or the short dimension
--   name <tt>statement</tt>. If you don't specify this parameter,
--   Performance Insights returns all dimension data within the specified
--   dimension group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceType:GetDimensionKeyDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetails_serviceType</a> - The AWS service for which
--   Performance Insights returns data. The only valid value is
--   <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifier:GetDimensionKeyDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetails_identifier</a> - The ID for a data source
--   from which to gather dimension data. This ID must be immutable and
--   unique within an AWS Region. When a DB instance is the data source,
--   specify its <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For example, specify
--   <tt>db-ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTU1VW2X</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:group':GetDimensionKeyDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetails_group</a> - The name of the dimension group.
--   The only valid value is <tt>db.sql</tt>. Performance Insights searches
--   the specified group for the dimension group ID.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupIdentifier:GetDimensionKeyDetails'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetails_groupIdentifier</a> - The ID of the
--   dimension group from which to retrieve dimension details. For
--   dimension group <tt>db.sql</tt>, the group ID is <tt>db.sql.id</tt>.
newGetDimensionKeyDetails :: ServiceType -> Text -> Text -> Text -> GetDimensionKeyDetails

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse
GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse' :: Maybe [DimensionKeyDetail] -> Int -> GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetailsResponse_dimensions</a> - The details for the
--   requested dimensions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getDimensionKeyDetailsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse :: Int -> GetDimensionKeyDetailsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetResourceMetrics</a> smart constructor.
data GetResourceMetrics
GetResourceMetrics' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> ServiceType -> Text -> NonEmpty MetricQuery -> POSIX -> POSIX -> GetResourceMetrics

-- | Create a value of <a>GetResourceMetrics</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:periodInSeconds:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetrics_periodInSeconds</a> - The granularity, in
--   seconds, of the data points returned from Performance Insights. A
--   period can be as short as one second, or as long as one day (86400
--   seconds). Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> (one second)</li>
--   <li><tt>60</tt> (one minute)</li>
--   <li><tt>300</tt> (five minutes)</li>
--   <li><tt>3600</tt> (one hour)</li>
--   <li><tt>86400</tt> (twenty-four hours)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>, then Performance
--   Insights will choose a value for you, with a goal of returning roughly
--   100-200 data points in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetrics_nextToken</a> - An optional pagination token
--   provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the
--   response includes only records beyond the token, up to the value
--   specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetrics_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of items to
--   return in the response. If more items exist than the specified
--   <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token is included in the
--   response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceType:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetrics_serviceType</a> - The AWS service for which
--   Performance Insights returns metrics. The only valid value for
--   <i>ServiceType</i> is <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifier:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetrics_identifier</a> - An immutable, AWS Region-unique
--   identifier for a data source. Performance Insights gathers metrics
--   from this data source.
--   
--   To use a DB instance as a data source, specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For example, specify
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricQueries:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetrics_metricQueries</a> - An array of one or more
--   queries to perform. Each query must specify a Performance Insights
--   metric, and can optionally specify aggregation and filtering criteria.
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetrics_startTime</a> - The date and time specifying the
--   beginning of the requested time series data. You can't specify a
--   <tt>StartTime</tt> that's earlier than 7 days ago. The value specified
--   is <i>inclusive</i> - data points equal to or greater than
--   <tt>StartTime</tt> will be returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>StartTime</tt> must be earlier than the value for
--   <tt>EndTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetrics_endTime</a> - The date and time specifying the
--   end of the requested time series data. The value specified is
--   <i>exclusive</i> - data points less than (but not equal to)
--   <tt>EndTime</tt> will be returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>EndTime</tt> must be later than the value for
--   <tt>StartTime</tt>.
newGetResourceMetrics :: ServiceType -> Text -> NonEmpty MetricQuery -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> GetResourceMetrics

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newGetResourceMetricsResponse</a> smart constructor.
data GetResourceMetricsResponse
GetResourceMetricsResponse' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [MetricKeyDataPoints] -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe Text -> Int -> GetResourceMetricsResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>GetResourceMetricsResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifier:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetricsResponse_identifier</a> - An immutable, AWS
--   Region-unique identifier for a data source. Performance Insights
--   gathers metrics from this data source.
--   
--   To use a DB instance as a data source, you specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value - for example:
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:metricList:GetResourceMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetricsResponse_metricList</a> - An array of metric
--   results,, where each array element contains all of the data points for
--   a particular dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignedEndTime:GetResourceMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetricsResponse_alignedEndTime</a> - The end time for
--   the returned metrics, after alignment to a granular boundary (as
--   specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>). <tt>AlignedEndTime</tt> will
--   be greater than or equal to the value of the user-specified
--   <tt>Endtime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignedStartTime:GetResourceMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetricsResponse_alignedStartTime</a> - The start time
--   for the returned metrics, after alignment to a granular boundary (as
--   specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>). <tt>AlignedStartTime</tt> will
--   be less than or equal to the value of the user-specified
--   <tt>StartTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:GetResourceMetrics'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetricsResponse_nextToken</a> - An optional pagination
--   token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified,
--   the response includes only records beyond the token, up to the value
--   specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:GetResourceMetricsResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getResourceMetricsResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newGetResourceMetricsResponse :: Int -> GetResourceMetricsResponse

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDimensionKeys</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDimensionKeys
DescribeDimensionKeys' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe DimensionGroup -> ServiceType -> Text -> POSIX -> POSIX -> Text -> DimensionGroup -> DescribeDimensionKeys

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDimensionKeys</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:periodInSeconds:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_periodInSeconds</a> - The granularity, in
--   seconds, of the data points returned from Performance Insights. A
--   period can be as short as one second, or as long as one day (86400
--   seconds). Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>1</tt> (one second)</li>
--   <li><tt>60</tt> (one minute)</li>
--   <li><tt>300</tt> (five minutes)</li>
--   <li><tt>3600</tt> (one hour)</li>
--   <li><tt>86400</tt> (twenty-four hours)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If you don't specify <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>, then Performance
--   Insights chooses a value for you, with a goal of returning roughly
--   100-200 data points in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_nextToken</a> - An optional pagination token
--   provided by a previous request. If this parameter is specified, the
--   response includes only records beyond the token, up to the value
--   specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_filter</a> - One or more filters to apply in
--   the request. Restrictions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any number of filters by the same dimension, as specified in the
--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> or <tt>Partition</tt> parameters.</li>
--   <li>A single filter for any other dimension in this dimension
--   group.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxResults:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_maxResults</a> - The maximum number of items
--   to return in the response. If more items exist than the specified
--   <tt>MaxRecords</tt> value, a pagination token is included in the
--   response so that the remaining results can be retrieved.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partitionBy:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_partitionBy</a> - For each dimension
--   specified in <tt>GroupBy</tt>, specify a secondary dimension to
--   further subdivide the partition keys in the response.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceType:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_serviceType</a> - The AWS service for which
--   Performance Insights will return metrics. The only valid value for
--   <i>ServiceType</i> is <tt>RDS</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:identifier:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_identifier</a> - An immutable, AWS
--   Region-unique identifier for a data source. Performance Insights
--   gathers metrics from this data source.
--   
--   To use an Amazon RDS instance as a data source, you specify its
--   <tt>DbiResourceId</tt> value. For example, specify
--   <tt>db-FAIHNTYBKTGAUSUZQYPDS2GW4A</tt>
--   
--   <a>$sel:startTime:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_startTime</a> - The date and time specifying
--   the beginning of the requested time series data. You must specify a
--   <tt>StartTime</tt> within the past 7 days. The value specified is
--   <i>inclusive</i>, which means that data points equal to or greater
--   than <tt>StartTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>StartTime</tt> must be earlier than the value for
--   <tt>EndTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endTime:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_endTime</a> - The date and time specifying
--   the end of the requested time series data. The value specified is
--   <i>exclusive</i>, which means that data points less than (but not
--   equal to) <tt>EndTime</tt> are returned.
--   
--   The value for <tt>EndTime</tt> must be later than the value for
--   <tt>StartTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_metric</a> - The name of a Performance
--   Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupBy:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeys_groupBy</a> - A specification for how to
--   aggregate the data points from a query result. You must specify a
--   valid dimension group. Performance Insights returns all dimensions
--   within this group, unless you provide the names of specific dimensions
--   within this group. You can also request that Performance Insights
--   return a limited number of values for a dimension.
newDescribeDimensionKeys :: ServiceType -> Text -> UTCTime -> UTCTime -> Text -> DimensionGroup -> DescribeDimensionKeys

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newDescribeDimensionKeysResponse</a> smart constructor.
data DescribeDimensionKeysResponse
DescribeDimensionKeysResponse' :: Maybe POSIX -> Maybe POSIX -> Maybe [DimensionKeyDescription] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [ResponsePartitionKey] -> Int -> DescribeDimensionKeysResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>DescribeDimensionKeysResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignedEndTime:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_alignedEndTime</a> - The end time for
--   the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a granular boundary
--   (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>). <tt>AlignedEndTime</tt>
--   will be greater than or equal to the value of the user-specified
--   <tt>Endtime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:alignedStartTime:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_alignedStartTime</a> - The start time
--   for the returned dimension keys, after alignment to a granular
--   boundary (as specified by <tt>PeriodInSeconds</tt>).
--   <tt>AlignedStartTime</tt> will be less than or equal to the value of
--   the user-specified <tt>StartTime</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:keys:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_keys</a> - The dimension keys that
--   were requested.
--   
--   <a>$sel:nextToken:DescribeDimensionKeys'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_nextToken</a> - An optional
--   pagination token provided by a previous request. If this parameter is
--   specified, the response includes only records beyond the token, up to
--   the value specified by <tt>MaxRecords</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:partitionKeys:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_partitionKeys</a> - If
--   <tt>PartitionBy</tt> was present in the request,
--   <tt>PartitionKeys</tt> contains the breakdown of dimension keys by the
--   specified partitions.
--   
--   <a>$sel:httpStatus:DescribeDimensionKeysResponse'</a>,
--   <a>describeDimensionKeysResponse_httpStatus</a> - The response's http
--   status code.
newDescribeDimensionKeysResponse :: Int -> DescribeDimensionKeysResponse
newtype DetailStatus
DetailStatus' :: Text -> DetailStatus
[fromDetailStatus] :: DetailStatus -> Text
pattern DetailStatus_AVAILABLE :: DetailStatus
pattern DetailStatus_PROCESSING :: DetailStatus
pattern DetailStatus_UNAVAILABLE :: DetailStatus
newtype ServiceType
ServiceType' :: Text -> ServiceType
[fromServiceType] :: ServiceType -> Text
pattern ServiceType_RDS :: ServiceType

-- | A timestamp, and a single numerical value, which together represent a
--   measurement at a particular point in time.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDataPoint</a> smart constructor.
data DataPoint
DataPoint' :: POSIX -> Double -> DataPoint

-- | Create a value of <a>DataPoint</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:timestamp:DataPoint'</a>, <a>dataPoint_timestamp</a> - The
--   time, in epoch format, associated with a particular <tt>Value</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:DataPoint'</a>, <a>dataPoint_value</a> - The actual
--   value associated with a particular <tt>Timestamp</tt>.
newDataPoint :: UTCTime -> Double -> DataPoint

-- | A logical grouping of Performance Insights metrics for a related
--   subject area. For example, the <tt>db.sql</tt> dimension group
--   consists of the following dimensions: <tt>db.sql.id</tt>,
--   <tt>db.sql.db_id</tt>, <tt>db.sql.statement</tt>, and
--   <tt>db.sql.tokenized_id</tt>.
--   
--   Each response element returns a maximum of 500 bytes. For larger
--   elements, such as SQL statements, only the first 500 bytes are
--   returned.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDimensionGroup</a> smart constructor.
data DimensionGroup
DimensionGroup' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe (NonEmpty Text) -> Text -> DimensionGroup

-- | Create a value of <a>DimensionGroup</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:limit:DimensionGroup'</a>, <a>dimensionGroup_limit</a> - The
--   maximum number of items to fetch for this dimension group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:DimensionGroup'</a>,
--   <a>dimensionGroup_dimensions</a> - A list of specific dimensions from
--   a dimension group. If this parameter is not present, then it signifies
--   that all of the dimensions in the group were requested, or are present
--   in the response.
--   
--   Valid values for elements in the <tt>Dimensions</tt> array are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.application.name</tt> - The name of the application that is
--   connected to the database (only Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS
--   PostgreSQL)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.host.id</tt> - The host ID of the connected client (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.host.name</tt> - The host name of the connected client (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.name</tt> - The name of the database to which the client is
--   connected (only Aurora PostgreSQL, RDS PostgreSQL, Aurora MySQL, RDS
--   MySQL, and MariaDB)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.session_type.name</tt> - The type of the current session
--   (only Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS PostgreSQL)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql.id</tt> - The SQL ID generated by Performance Insights
--   (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql.db_id</tt> - The SQL ID generated by the database (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql.statement</tt> - The SQL text that is being executed
--   (all engines)</li>
--   <li><pre>db.sql.tokenized_id</pre></li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql_tokenized.id</tt> - The SQL digest ID generated by
--   Performance Insights (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql_tokenized.db_id</tt> - SQL digest ID generated by the
--   database (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql_tokenized.statement</tt> - The SQL digest text (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.user.id</tt> - The ID of the user logged in to the database
--   (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.user.name</tt> - The name of the user logged in to the
--   database (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event.name</tt> - The event for which the backend is
--   waiting (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event.type</tt> - The type of event for which the
--   backend is waiting (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event_type.name</tt> - The name of the event type for
--   which the backend is waiting (all engines)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:group':DimensionGroup'</a>, <a>dimensionGroup_group</a> - The
--   name of the dimension group. Valid values are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db</tt> - The name of the database to which the client is
--   connected (only Aurora PostgreSQL, RDS PostgreSQL, Aurora MySQL, RDS
--   MySQL, and MariaDB)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.application</tt> - The name of the application that is
--   connected to the database (only Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS
--   PostgreSQL)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.host</tt> - The host name of the connected client (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.session_type</tt> - The type of the current session (only
--   Aurora PostgreSQL and RDS PostgreSQL)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql</tt> - The SQL that is currently executing (all
--   engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sql_tokenized</tt> - The SQL digest (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event</tt> - The event for which the database backend
--   is waiting (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.wait_event_type</tt> - The type of event for which the
--   database backend is waiting (all engines)</li>
--   <li><tt>db.user</tt> - The user logged in to the database (all
--   engines)</li>
--   </ul>
newDimensionGroup :: Text -> DimensionGroup

-- | An array of descriptions and aggregated values for each dimension
--   within a dimension group.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDimensionKeyDescription</a> smart constructor.
data DimensionKeyDescription
DimensionKeyDescription' :: Maybe [Double] -> Maybe Double -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> DimensionKeyDescription

-- | Create a value of <a>DimensionKeyDescription</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:partitions:DimensionKeyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>dimensionKeyDescription_partitions</a> - If <tt>PartitionBy</tt>
--   was specified, <tt>PartitionKeys</tt> contains the dimensions that
--   were.
--   
--   <a>$sel:total:DimensionKeyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>dimensionKeyDescription_total</a> - The aggregated metric value for
--   the dimension(s), over the requested time range.
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:DimensionKeyDescription'</a>,
--   <a>dimensionKeyDescription_dimensions</a> - A map of name-value pairs
--   for the dimensions in the group.
newDimensionKeyDescription :: DimensionKeyDescription

-- | An object that describes the details for a specified dimension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDimensionKeyDetail</a> smart constructor.
data DimensionKeyDetail
DimensionKeyDetail' :: Maybe DetailStatus -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> DimensionKeyDetail

-- | Create a value of <a>DimensionKeyDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:DimensionKeyDetail'</a>,
--   <a>dimensionKeyDetail_status</a> - The status of the dimension detail
--   data. Possible values include the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>AVAILABLE</tt> - The dimension detail data is ready to be
--   retrieved.</li>
--   <li><tt>PROCESSING</tt> - The dimension detail data isn't ready to be
--   retrieved because more processing time is required. If the requested
--   detail data for <tt>db.sql.statement</tt> has the status
--   <tt>PROCESSING</tt>, Performance Insights returns the truncated
--   query.</li>
--   <li><tt>UNAVAILABLE</tt> - The dimension detail data could not be
--   collected successfully.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimension:DimensionKeyDetail'</a>,
--   <a>dimensionKeyDetail_dimension</a> - The full name of the dimension.
--   The full name includes the group name and key name. The only valid
--   value is <tt>db.sql.statement</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:DimensionKeyDetail'</a>, <a>dimensionKeyDetail_value</a>
--   - The value of the dimension detail data. For the
--   <tt>db.sql.statement</tt> dimension, this value is either the full or
--   truncated SQL query, depending on the return status.
newDimensionKeyDetail :: DimensionKeyDetail

-- | A time-ordered series of data points, corresponding to a dimension of
--   a Performance Insights metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricKeyDataPoints</a> smart constructor.
data MetricKeyDataPoints
MetricKeyDataPoints' :: Maybe [DataPoint] -> Maybe ResponseResourceMetricKey -> MetricKeyDataPoints

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricKeyDataPoints</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dataPoints:MetricKeyDataPoints'</a>,
--   <a>metricKeyDataPoints_dataPoints</a> - An array of timestamp-value
--   pairs, representing measurements over a period of time.
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:MetricKeyDataPoints'</a>, <a>metricKeyDataPoints_key</a> -
--   The dimension(s) to which the data points apply.
newMetricKeyDataPoints :: MetricKeyDataPoints

-- | A single query to be processed. You must provide the metric to query.
--   If no other parameters are specified, Performance Insights returns all
--   of the data points for that metric. You can optionally request that
--   the data points be aggregated by dimension group ( <tt>GroupBy</tt>),
--   and return only those data points that match your criteria
--   (<tt>Filter</tt>).
--
