--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMetricQuery</a> smart constructor.
data MetricQuery
MetricQuery' :: Maybe DimensionGroup -> Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> MetricQuery

-- | Create a value of <a>MetricQuery</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupBy:MetricQuery'</a>, <a>metricQuery_groupBy</a> - A
--   specification for how to aggregate the data points from a query
--   result. You must specify a valid dimension group. Performance Insights
--   will return all of the dimensions within that group, unless you
--   provide the names of specific dimensions within that group. You can
--   also request that Performance Insights return a limited number of
--   values for a dimension.
--   
--   <a>$sel:filter':MetricQuery'</a>, <a>metricQuery_filter</a> - One or
--   more filters to apply in the request. Restrictions:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any number of filters by the same dimension, as specified in the
--   <tt>GroupBy</tt> parameter.</li>
--   <li>A single filter for any other dimension in this dimension
--   group.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:MetricQuery'</a>, <a>metricQuery_metric</a> - The name
--   of a Performance Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
newMetricQuery :: Text -> MetricQuery

-- | If <tt>PartitionBy</tt> was specified in a
--   <tt>DescribeDimensionKeys</tt> request, the dimensions are returned in
--   an array. Each element in the array specifies one dimension.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResponsePartitionKey</a> smart constructor.
data ResponsePartitionKey
ResponsePartitionKey' :: HashMap Text Text -> ResponsePartitionKey

-- | Create a value of <a>ResponsePartitionKey</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:ResponsePartitionKey'</a>,
--   <a>responsePartitionKey_dimensions</a> - A dimension map that contains
--   the dimension(s) for this partition.
newResponsePartitionKey :: ResponsePartitionKey

-- | An object describing a Performance Insights metric and one or more
--   dimensions for that metric.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResponseResourceMetricKey</a> smart constructor.
data ResponseResourceMetricKey
ResponseResourceMetricKey' :: Maybe (HashMap Text Text) -> Text -> ResponseResourceMetricKey

-- | Create a value of <a>ResponseResourceMetricKey</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:dimensions:ResponseResourceMetricKey'</a>,
--   <a>responseResourceMetricKey_dimensions</a> - The valid dimensions for
--   the metric.
--   
--   <a>$sel:metric:ResponseResourceMetricKey'</a>,
--   <a>responseResourceMetricKey_metric</a> - The name of a Performance
--   Insights metric to be measured.
--   
--   Valid values for <tt>Metric</tt> are:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li><tt>db.load.avg</tt> - a scaled representation of the number of
--   active sessions for the database engine.</li>
--   <li><tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> - the raw number of active sessions
--   for the database engine.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   If the number of active sessions is less than an internal Performance
--   Insights threshold, <tt>db.load.avg</tt> and
--   <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> are the same value. If the number of
--   active sessions is greater than the internal threshold, Performance
--   Insights samples the active sessions, with <tt>db.load.avg</tt>
--   showing the scaled values, <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> showing the raw
--   values, and <tt>db.sampledload.avg</tt> less than
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt>. For most use cases, you can query
--   <tt>db.load.avg</tt> only.
newResponseResourceMetricKey :: Text -> ResponseResourceMetricKey
